title: Quickest Change Detection with Cost-Constrained Experiment Design
summary: This paper addresses the quickest change detection problem where an observer monitors a stochastic process and, at each observation time, chooses between multiple experiments with different information qualities and costs. The goal is to minimize the worst-case average detection delay subject to false alarm and cost constraints. An algorithm called the 2E-CUSUM Algorithm is developed for this purpose.
usefulness_reason: Score 65 assigned because the paper focuses on 'quickest change detection' in a 'stochastic process', which is directly relevant to the concept of 'Point Process'. While it doesn't explicitly mention 'spatio-temporal' aspects, the core methodology of monitoring a stochastic process over time aligns with the broader theme of point processes.
